009package Ch11_Circles_Ellipses;
010
011import static java.lang.Math.PI;
012
013import java.awt.Color;
014import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
015import java.util.Random;
016
017import ij.ImagePlus;
018import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
019import ij.gui.NewImage;
020import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
022import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.project.ConfocalConicEllipseProjector;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.project.EllipseProjector;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.project.OrthogonalEllipseProjector;
026import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
027import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
028import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
029
030/**
031 * <p>
032 * This plugin creates a new image with an ellipse and a set of random points.
033 * For each point, the closest (contact) point on the ellipse is
034 * calculated and a connecting line is drawn to a vector overlay.
035 * Two closest-point algorithms are available (see Secs. 11.2.2 and 11.2.3 of [1] 
036 * for additional details):
037 * </p>
038 * <ol>
039 * <li> orthogonal, exact closest point (iterative) and </li>
040 * <li> approximate confocal conic closest point estimation (non-iterative).</li>
041 * </ol>
042 * <p>
043 * The random seed may be specified for repeatability of experiments.
044 * </p>
045 * <p>
046 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
047 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
048 * </p>
049 * 
050 * @author WB
051 *
052 */
053public class Ellipse_Closest_Points_Demo implements PlugIn {
054        
055        private static int W = 400;
056        private static int H = 400;
057        private static int N = 250;
058        private static int Seed = 11;
059        
060        private static final double StrokeWidth = 1.0;
061        private static final Color EllipseColor = Color.green;
062        private static final Color PointColor = Color.blue;
063        private static ClosestPointAlgorithm Algorithm = ClosestPointAlgorithm.Orthogonal;
064        
065        public enum ClosestPointAlgorithm {
066                Orthogonal, ConfocalConics
067        }
068        
069        @Override
070        public void run(String arg) {
071                
072                if (!runDialog()) {
073                        return;
074                }
075                
076                //GeometricEllipse realEllipse = new GeometricEllipse(170, 120, 200, 190, PI/7);                // example 1
077                GeometricEllipse realEllipse = new GeometricEllipse(1100, 120, 25, 1200, PI/2 + 0.2);   // example 2
078                
079                String title = this.getClass().getSimpleName() + " (" + Algorithm.toString() + ")";
080                ImagePlus im = NewImage.createByteImage(title, W, H, 1, NewImage.FILL_WHITE);
081                
082                ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter();
083                
084                ColoredStroke ellipseStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, EllipseColor);
085                ColoredStroke pointStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, PointColor);
086                ola.addShapes(realEllipse.getShapes(), ellipseStroke);
087                
088                EllipseProjector projector = null;
089                switch (Algorithm) {
090                case Orthogonal:
091                        projector = new OrthogonalEllipseProjector(realEllipse);
092                        break;
093                case ConfocalConics:
094                        projector = new ConfocalConicEllipseProjector(realEllipse);
095                        break;
096                }
097                
098                Random rd = (Seed == 0) ? new Random() : new Random(Seed);
099
100                for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
101                        Pnt2d p = Pnt2d.from(W * rd.nextDouble(), H* rd.nextDouble());
102                        Pnt2d p0 = projector.project(p);
103                        // draw connecting line:
104                        Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
105                        path.moveTo(p.getX(), p.getY());
106                        path.lineTo(p0.getX(), p0.getY());
107                        ola.addShape(path);
108                        // draw point p:
109                        ola.addShape(p.getShape(), pointStroke);
110                }
111                
112                im.setOverlay(ola.getOverlay());
113                im.show();
114        }
115
116        private boolean runDialog() {
117                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
118                
119                gd.addMessage(DialogUtils.makeLineSeparatedString(
120                                "This plugin creates a new image with an ellipse and a",
121                                "set of random points. For each point, the closest (contact)",
122                                "point on the ellipse is calculated and a connecting line",
123                                "is drawn to a vector overlay."
124                                ));
125                
126                gd.addNumericField("Number of random points", N, 0);
127                gd.addNumericField("Random seed (0 = none)", Seed, 0);
128                gd.addEnumChoice("Closest-point method", Algorithm);
129                
130                gd.showDialog();
131                if (gd.wasCanceled())
132                        return false;
133                
134                N = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
135                Seed = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
136                Algorithm = gd.getNextEnumChoice(ClosestPointAlgorithm.class);
137                
138                return true;
139        }
140        
141}
